deck: Color Guide that was in English or Spanish.
description: This is the first time the ULDM was in full color.
name: Color Guide

volume.name: The Unbelievable Laundry Detergent Man Guide

description: Translates Arrow 2.5 #1-6.
name: Band 1

description: Translates Convergence: Batman & Robin #1-2.
Translates Convergence: Detective Comics #1-2, Convergence: Shadow of the Bat #1-2, Convergence: Batman and the Outsiders #1-2 & Convergence: Batgirl #1-2.
Translates Convergence #4-5.
Translates Convergence: The Flash #1-2 & Convergence: Speed Force #1-2.
Translates Convergence: Green Lantern #38-40.

Welcome, Kimetsu no Yaiba! Our new Jump Start! Legend has it, a flesh-eating demon hunts in the woods at night. But it's only a myth. Right? And in Bleach, a fan favorite makes an appearance! Get ready to laugh! Plus the Hikaru no Go Jump Back continues!

Table of Contents

MangaChapter #Chapter Name
Kimetsu No Yaiba1Cruelty
Bleach662God Of Thunder 3
One Piece816Dog Vs. Cat
My Hero Academia 78Whirling Chaos
Nisekoi 205That's It
World Trigger 131Galopoula: Part 10
Toriko 358Nasty Neo!!
Food Wars!154Bearing Fangs
Black Clover 49Sin For Sin
Hikaru no Go2From A Level Beyond
name: No. 11, February 15, 2016

deck: First colored pencil issue of this fun series.
description: This was a comic book co-created by Nino Mesarina and Ralphy Ramirez.
name: Thrills, Chills, Spills, Clean Ups!!

person_credits.name: Jose Mesarina
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
The first issue had art by Nino Mesarina, who in turn ran a short black and white about the ULDM who wanted to get Don Kramers signature. The artist Nino Mesarina happens to be old school mates, and this was down as a nod to his friend.

Meanwhile there is art by Jake Estrada and a pin-up of Bocas.

person_credits.name: Jake Estrada
person_credits.role: writer, artist, letterer, inker, colorist, journalist, production

description: Translates Convergence: Justice League #1-2.

Jimmy Watts and his BugHouse band are the toast of the town, as the red-hot Bebop jazz band takes the stage of the storied Club Savoy. But lookout, sleazy purveyors of the highly addictive substance "bug-juice" flock around Jimmy. In no time, Jimmy takes a slug in a back-alley drug deal gone sour!

"What if Raymond Chander wrote Lovecraft stories?"

Set in the mid-1940s, Strange Cases follows Hank Flynn, a down on his luck private eye who is back from the war and now working the mean streets of the most cursed city on Earth-Arkham, Massachusetts. And things only get worse for Flynn when a wealthy uptown socialite hires him to track down an artist by the name of Pickman. What begins as a simple missing persons case leads Flynn down a dark path of flesh eating ghouls, vengeful witches, and the notorious Innsmouth mafia.
name: Vol. 1

volume.name: Casefile: Arkham, Nightmare on the Canvas

description: Strange things happen and people die as the witch has appeared to escape. Now, the Tal-Ifatiir order is terrified, and they are starting to blame Chadhiyana for all their supernatural misfortunes.
William Bennett, Richard Bennett's younger brother, attends a celebration prior to his departure to the war's frontline. Liam Ramsey begins his vampire hunter training.
name: Vol. 2

description: Sister Long finally moves to a different region of the Tokyo area, and she's surrounded by new friends. Although it's sometimes overwhelming trying to adjust to the area and learn all the new names and faces, she find more joy in the work than ever before.
name: Month 9: October

volume.name: DENDO: One Year and One Half in Tokyo

description:
Battle 07

As Dae ropes Raid and June into his plans, Morris enacts his plan to take out the heroes once and for all.
name: Battle 7

description:
Monsters: Cara's Story

Cara struggles to get by in a society riddled with anxiety and suspicion over the growing Alter crisis. What does she have to fear and what is behind her obsession with insects? Agents exercise newly granted powers to respond to the crisis while these same powers are debated on national television. And, what is the connection with the continuing disappearances of people?

Falling Star is an original ongoing comic series created, written and drawn by Crisitan Roux. Focusing on a number of super-powered characters each trying to reconcile the nature of their gift, or curse, and their place in the world confronting them. Currently, a twice yearly publication with an emphasis on producing a high quality comic both in story and art. Each issue features a full colour wrap-around cover and contains 24-28 internal pages of grayscale art.
name: Monsters: Cara's Story

description:
Putting your heart on the line

It's November and the final 9 players are one day way from sitting down to compete in the biggest tournament of their life.
name: Putting Your Heart On the Line

description:
This story centers on Wiz (a charming and eccentric gentleman), Hela (a tech enthusiast with hoarding problems), Heyden (a strange kid with even stranger powers) and Adamant (a hot-headed man in power armor who is probably from planet earth) who travel through the planes with the impossible goal of drawing a map of the infinite multiverse.

This six book series will show only some of their adventures along the years: They get hunted like wild animals, help an ancient robot civilization meet their creators, stop an ignoble war and access Gods-only places, all while taking measurements and gathering data. They even manage to get their humongous map back when it gets stolen by the very people they were helping, which leads to the map's ultimate destruction and Wiz seeing the full gargantuan thing at once for the first time.

Agents of S.P.E.A.R.

So, remember how half the population got superpowers?

Well, while people were figuring out how to fly the incarcerated were putting their powers to use.

So it's now up to Zach and his friends, along with the black-coat wearing organization they've just been drafted into, to deal with the country that once had the the highest number of prisoners, and now has the highest number of fugitives.
name: Agents of S.P.E.A.R.

description:
Candied Sheep Day

And you thought YOUR job was hell!

Doug is a lowly office demon at Hell, Inc. His devillish boss, B.L. Zebub, is out for revenge after being embarrassed by his lackadaisical employee, leading to encounters with damned souls, accounting harpies, and Slava the IT guy. To make matters worse, it's Doug's most cherished day of the year - the day the candied sheep cart sets up in the lobby!

Available for the first time digitally, the 2010 sequel to the comic about a job worse than yours can now easily be read on company time!
name: Candied Sheep Day

description: Vincent starts tracking down individuals that might be able to lead him to the not-yet-famous Jack the Ripper. But he better be careful as unbeknownst to him, people are watching!

To Hull And Back

When engine failure traps Lou, Vic and Mal outside the ship, Crysta and Earl must risk and life and limb to save them!
name: To Hull And Back

description:
Soul in Iron Part 2

A classic revenge-fueled spaghetti western with a supernatural and steampunk twist.

"Mercy is Just My Name," is the story the mysterious itinerant preacher and vigilante, Sister Mercy Goode, who travels an epic re-imagining of the American West dispensing justice with a bible or a colt.

Episode 2:

"Merciless" Goode and her ward, Pet, confront Captain Andre Dubois, a "clockwork" augmented war criminal near the graveyard of the last battle of the Civil War.
name: Soul in Iron Part 2

description:
Enter the Mucho conclusion: An Ahole for an A-hole's A-hole

Red Herring terrorizes Tokyo! How will our heroes defeat a villain who has all of the creatures of the sea under his thrall? Will the citizens of Japan ever look at sushi the same way again?

In this issue:

Explosions!

Flatulence!

Mucho Man Metamorphosed!

A Bear eating a Narwhal!
name: Enter the Mucho Conclusion: An Ahole For An A-hole's A-hole

description: In this episode, our favourite Australian hero (and sheep rustler) leads a brave mission to rescue his fiancée Ettie from the clutches of the evil Baratha. Ned then finds an unlikely new ally, and learns some critical new information about the alien First Fleet!
name: Episode Three

description:
The Motherload

The first book in a new series... Inept wizard Pewfell may hate his job as a McLurgi's Magic Shoppe sales associate, but otherwise things are going pretty well for him in the rural hamlet of Blotchley-on-Soddon. However, the tranquility of his new life is about to be shattered by a visit from his untamed barbarian in-laws. Meanwhile his diminutive manager, Gnoma, has just received a mysterious consignment from head office. Great jumping-in point for new readers!

Thanks to everyone who's reading Pewfell on ComiXology. Support digital comics on Comixology. ComiXology is the future of comics. ComiXology is the medium that is allowing me to bring you more Pewfell.
name: The Motherload

description:
What I don´t understand, Pirata, is how can you fail in maths, being so advanced in this subject and seeing how well you dominate the BINARY SYSTEM because...

You just get ZEROS AND ONES!!!
name: How Stupid You Are Pirate

description: Taking place in the mid 1800s, Roy Whales is a cowboy out hunting buffalo. While hunting, he catches a fever and at the same time a sickness spreads in his home town of Red Town. Village folk are acting erratic and are quarantined. Roy, who is thought to be infected, is thrown in with the sick and sent off into the ocean on a boat to die. The adventure really begins when Roy finds the ship has wrecked on an island with pirates!

Heart Upon My Sleeve

In Poverty Thrill Adventures, find out the secret origins of your favorite heroes from Poverty Pack!

Gidgette Florie becomes a champion for charities, but her boss has other plans for her. She becomes the unwilling tool for his evil and suffers for it. How will she escape his clutches and bring him to justice?
"My house will be purged and all without virtue set to flame." Shepherd 10:41

The second collection of the long-running, gay, comic strip, "Troy". Set in a slightly fictional version of West Hollywood, CA, quite possibly the gayest little city in North America, "Troy" follows the lives and loves of Troy, his roommate Rigo, Rigo's boyfriend Jorge, and their friends Ray and Derrick. In this one, Troy meets his evil, younger, fresher doppelgänger, makes a splash at the gay porn awards, and gets cast in the new, very gay, musical, "Naked Boys Behind Bars, Sing!" where he meets the hunky, "straight," bottom-boy Nick. Includes "Troy" strips 51 to 100.
name: My West Hollywood Lifestyle, Whatever!

description:
The Daedalus Spear

Max, the leader of 3CORPS is faced against a enraged Super Human named Gabriel Luciano. Max must stop him before he discovers the location of the Daedalus Spear in the super secret facility called Station Zero in the heart of the Amazon jungle!
name: The Daedalus Spear

description:
Track 1

The very first issue of 7STRING and where it all starts! Zach fights for the first time with the incredible 7STRING guitar sword and learns a significant lesson...
name: Track 1

description:
Coming to the world, for the first time - Issue 333 of A.R.K, the latest issue of the longest running anthology comic that you've never heard of.

In the finest traditions of the classics some stories will be ending, some stories beginning, and some will be somewhere in between. A.R.K crosses genres - from derring-do in the deep void with a Paladin of Charlemagne, emperor of space, to the adventures of The Red Menace a super-powered tearaway turned would be hero faced with his greatest challenge to date. From the trials and tribulations of the Platinum Angels - the most famous girl band/mecha pilots in the solar system - to the debut of Gymshoe, a determined young detective in the finest traditions of Playground Noir.

A.R.K, all the adventure and excitement that we, under the watchful eye of vigilant editor Robot George could squeeze into 24 pages.

“Alexander and the Book of Knowledge" is a 35 page, All Ages, one shot comic book created by Asaad Loiseau (writer) and Ryan Butt (artist). It follows Alexander’s search to go on a grand adventure of a life time. A mysterious wizard tasks Alexander and Rose with finding The Book Of Knowledge. Hungry for a fun journey, Alexander embarks on the quest unknown of the perils that await.

volume.name: Alexander and the Book of Knowledge

description: Two worlds collide on a distant planet. Revolving around its star but failing to rotate has created two extremes - a side of eternal sunlight and one of maddening darkness. At the border where light fades into dark, one man controls it all. Fueled by revenge, hatred and love, three friends set out to stop the corruption and start their world spinning, changing their lives forever.

Horror comic superstars Steve Niles and Nat Jones weave a tale of the bleak future: a moon cracked by nuclear armageddon, a human race reduced to nomadic tribes, and a civilization of monsters that rise up to fill the empty cities. When vampires threaten the future of the planet itself with a scheme involving toxic waste, humans and werewolves are forced to team up to stop them-and recruit all the other monsters they manage to find in the apocalyptic wasteland.

Note: The digital edition (2/10/2016) for this volume was released before the print edition.
name: TPB

volume.name: Broken Moon: Welcome to the New Age

description:
Student Survival Guide

Jamie, Paige, and Brittany will teach you everything you need to know about surviving a zombie apocalypse! Take classes on Zombie 101, Weapons 101, and even Sexual Solutions in Stressful Situations!
name: Student Survival Guide

description: Who killed the Tooth Fairy? Fairies have always existed in secret, living side-by-side with humankind. But, when one of his daughters is murdered, King Oberon tasks his remaining offspring -- a newly-minted NYPD detective (Charli) and a wingless, feral "black sheep" (Lucy) -- with finding her killer by any means necessary.

A Prologue

Three short stories that form a prologue to the future series, The Ghosts In Space.
name: A Prologue

description: Amy Pill is a genius and a slacker who'd rather surf than grind out her day job in 2439, building anti-gravity units for deep-space vehicles. But when her shoddy factory begins to implode around her, will her gritty genius be enough to save her?

The Heart Man is a character born of Barbadian folklore. A forgotten terror that haunted the night in past decades has returned to Bayker's Ridge. Follow a group of young friends as they deal with the everyday trials of life; friendship, love, crime, drugs and now mysterious disappearances and killings in Bayker's Ridge.
name: Vol. 1

description:
PETRICHOR

In a post apocalyptic world where the sun beams down on the dry land a bounty hunter name 'Saradiel' struggles to survive in this deadly wasteland where power is everything.
name: Petrichor

description: The peasants have had enough of the local warlord. For too long they have suffered in silence under the tyrannical rule of the Daimyo. To survive the coming winter, they will have to take a gamble. Will the legendary Kitsune answer their call? Will she succeed in her mission to assassinate the tyrant?

The Goddess With No Believers

Wandering spirits Brigid and Cassander stumble on a powerful child with an extraordinary destiny, and are told by their goddess to become her teachers.
name: The Goddess With No Believers

description:
You ALWAYS have to play the cards you're dealt. . .

or do you?

Lucky is a down-on-his-luck call centre worker who thinks everything would fall into place if only he could win more at poker.

After Lucky loses big at the casino, a mysterious stranger offers him a deal to make his dream come true. But there's a catch: Whatever good luck Lucky has INSIDE the casino, he will have an equal amount of BAD luck in his everyday life.

Will Lucky's dream become a (hilarious) nightmare? Find out in Lucky Unlucky Volume 1!
name: Volume 1

description: A woman's journey for identity told across varied perceptions of reality. The entire narrative is relayed through internal monologue.

Known only to science fiction fans as the Doctor, a being who explores the timeline in order to save the world from dangers both mysterious and impossible, the BBC’s Dr. Who is the longest running sci-fi TV series of all time, and the secret to its longev

"Road to Nowhere"

Meet Jheryd and his virtual girl-friday IVI as they traverse the many realms of the Omniverse!
name: Road to Nowhere

description: This book is the first Scenes From A Multiverse collection ever! With more than five full-color comics to treasure and cherish and someday bequeath to your heirs, SFAM Vol. 1 will literally tear you a new one, several inches to the left of the original one. Contains bunnies, giant robots and measurable quantities of spite. Features an introduction by Queen Skepchick Rebecca Watson.
name: Vol. 1

description:
Series 1 Episode 1: Ambition

Serious follows an ambitious young man called Blake, who plans to escape his poor neighbourhood of Serveton to the big city known as "The Jungle".

In issue 1 Blake and his trusted partner Cassy, the town hustlers, are making a name for themselves. All seems rosy until Blake is forced to face a harsh reality of business in Serveton...
name: Series 1 Episode 1: Ambition

description:
Track One: Leaving Home

Johanna Jones, a runaway from the town of Anthem receives a letter from the SSCC informing her that her father has gone missing after The September, the ship he was aboard, failed to return on time. They plan on repossessing her childhood home and allow her several days to collect any important belongings. Johanna reluctantly returns home to try to put together an expedition to search for The September's whereabouts. Along with her best friend, a washed up elderly ex-punk rocker, an on again off again addict, and a cat named Arpeggio, she sets off on a yellow submarine called the Heart of Gold for Hades' Hexagon, a mysterious area where ships keep disappearing.

From the creator of Dragon Slayer comes a 40+ page full color comic about the transformative power of music.
name: Track One: Leaving Home

description: Socute the Corgi wakes up to a beautiful day and is super excited about taking a walk in the park. Somehow, Socute gets lost in the woods and is helpless to find his way back to his owner. Thankfully, he makes friends who help him find his way home.

Intended for a mature audience, SPLIT is a dark slice of life that follows a mother and her children in very serious trouble. It begins with a tragic event, and carries us through the after effects that ripple beyond the year that follows. The family has found a way to cope, but the sustained isolation seems to be doing more harm than good.

Where There Are Shadows

In 1938, Obsidian Bay is a city of the future. It is also infested with villainy and corruption. Crime has slithered its way into every corner of the city, including the police force. Detective Frank Donavin has spent years taking money from the Mancini crime organization. Now Frank is in dire straits, as he is approached with an offer by Kizam Krey, emissary of the city's mysterious protector, The Stalker.
name: Where There Are Shadows

description: A lonely gorgon who turned her lover to stone...a mad scientist determined to create his ideal woman, no matter how many tries it takes...a man who uses time travel to fix his relationship problems...a contest winner who develops a bizarre fixation...and much more! This first volume of Strange Romance features 14 comic stories by up-and-coming writers and artists.

ALIEN KILLERS! MUTATED SEA MONSTERS! HUMANITY’S LAST GASP!

Months after mysterious corals drew 99% of humanity into the sea, a band of survivors ekes out a hollow existence on a remote British island.

When two people are cast up on the beach, completely blue, but very much alive, the island is thrown into turmoil.

What caused the mass extinction event? How did these two return from the deep, when billions died? Most importantly, what is the coral, and what does it want with the Earth?

The creeping, psychological horror fable that became a critical hit, the complete Surface Tension saga, finally collected!

Note: The digital edition (2/10/2016) for this volume was released before the print edition.
name: TPB

description: Edgar Allan Poe's classic tales "The Tell Tale Heart" and "The Conqueror Worm" are adapted in this first issue of "Tales of Mystery and Imagination". H. P. Lovecraft, that other fine master of horror, is represented by adaptations of his atmospheric "Dagon" and terrifying "From Beyond".

Vampires Will Never Hurt You

Jamie is a non-binary teenager who loves Halloween. When school bully Travis escalates his routine torture of them and their best friend, Vicky, trick or treating just doesn't seem safe.

After Vicky raises concerns over Jamie's unsettling new costume, the decision is an obvious one. Jamie is not going out with Vicky on Halloween night.

But something is.

The Way of the Cross, as envisioned by writer David Goulet and artist Joe Spicer, is a fresh exploration of a timeless meditation. This illustrated booklet will appeal primarily to middle-school readers, but older audiences will also find it a meaningful reflection.

Los Angeles, home of the beautiful, the vain and more often than not, the repulsive. Set against the back drop of Downtown HELL.A. where an eclectic group of survivors come face to face with a Zombie apocalypse. Led by the last guy on Earth you're going to call for help when the shit goes down.

TL;DR: Zombies over run Los Angeles and an asshole is the hero.

Crafty old Grampa Overnid has died (or has he?), leaving behind a mysterious request for his family. Monster fights, river rafting, and mystically manipulative family drama await those who dare venture where ever flows the river!

It's a detective agency run by witches! Psyche and the Black Enchantress star in their first trade paperback collection, featuring their origin stories and all the occult mysteries from Black Enchantress #1-3 and WitchGirls Inc #1. Cover by classic Doctor Strange artist Frank Brunner!
name: Volume 1

description:
The Yellow Planet, tells a dystopic and darkly humorous tale of an alien finding the abandoned Earth hundreds of years in the future. Her discoveries - a Yesso petrol station and a fun-size box of LocoPops - and how her culture interpret them, reveal more about our culture than hers, and the aliens have more in common with us than we might at first think.

The Yellow Planet is an imagined time capsule sent from the future to our present. It is a story about cosmic yearning.

volume.name: Korak: Suplemento do Mundo de Aventuras

name: De Ijzervreter: In de Eerste Linie

description:
It seemed that the Grossin brothers couldn't be more different.

Marc was a mild-mannered watchmaker - the occupying German garrison had used his skills to mend various timepieces dotted around their base.

Meanwhile, his younger brother, Bernard, was a member of the local French Resistance and he had begun to wonder if Marc was getting too friendly with the Nazis.

That was the least of Bernard's worries, though. During a shoot-out at a ruined churchyard, he wondered if he was finally

OUT OF TIME
name: Out of Time

description:
One man held the key to the operation called by the codeword - "TORCH" - the huge Allied invasion of North Africa. His name was Pete Macrory, a Canadian in the Royal Engineers - and nobody trusted him an inch.

To find out why, and what made Pete tick in his own peculiar way, you had to go way back to General Wolfe's attack on Quebec in 1759. That's when a distant ancestor of Pete's, young Jock Macrory, was involved in a deadly adventure of his own...

Note: Originally published as Commando No 220 (July 1966) and was re-issued as No 859 (August 1974).
name: Codeword - "Torch"

description:
When their unit was wiped out in the Blitzkrieg that heralded the beginning of World War II, Lieutenant Bartek Abramski and Sergeant Jakub Brejnak reluctantly found themselves on the run from the Germans.

These proud Uhlan cavalrymen were determined to survive and live to continue their fight another day. As time wore on, though, the chances of this seemed increasingly slim. However, when they teamed up with a downed pilot, a fellow Pole, it looked like they might have a chance to escape the clutches of the enemy…
name: Polish Pride

description:
It took nerves of steel to survive in the deadly skies over war-torn Europe…Pilot Officer Chris Bennet had proved that. Or so his fellow pilots thought. They reckoned he was the bravest guy they knew.

But even steel can break, and so could Chris…

Note: Originally published as Commando No 2470 (May 1991).
name: Dive and Kill!

description:
Hard as nails and hot as hell, badass bounty hunter Barb Wire rides the meanest streets of America’s toughest town: Steel Harbor, USA. Barb tracks gangsters who can punch through walls and crush cars like beer cans, but it’s a living. Call her a bitch—just don’t call her babe! Collects Barb Wire #1–#4.

Cover by Adam Hughes!
name: Book 1
